alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 22 at 2:34PM MDT until April 22 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IS NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH 12 AM MDT TONIGHT FOR AREAS ALONG AND EAST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN DUE TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS, INCLUDING VERY STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 9 PM TODAY FOR AREAS WEST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN DUE TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS, INCLUDING VERY STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR ALL OF EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .A widespread extreme and potentially catastrophic fire weather event is underway and will continue through the evening hours for areas along/east of the central mountain chain. Strong to damaging winds will continue to impact all of northern and central New Mexico while the very dry and unstable conditions persist. Though winds will not be as strong as today, critical fire weather conditions will persist Saturday across all of eastern New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau, North Central Mountains, Northwest Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, and the West Central Highlands through late this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 35 to 45 mph with occasional gusts to 60 mph this afternoon, shifting to the west and decreasing 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 55 mph early this evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 8 to 13 percent late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
